net.sourceforge.taglets.driver
Interface Driver

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDriver, TagletDriver, TagletDriver
public interface Driver

Driver for JavaDoc compliant taglets.

The driver converts SimpleTaglets to JavaDoc compliant taglets. The actual taglet implementation required is JavaDoc specific, therefore concrete driver implementations will return different taglet types.

Version:
1.7 (2008/03/30 12:43:25)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>
See Also:
convert(SimpleTaglet)
Since:
1.3.1

isPreferredDriver

boolean isPreferredDriver()
Checks if this driver is the preferred driver for the running version of JavaDoc.

Returns:
true if the driver thinks it can handle the current JavaDoc version and thinks it is the best driver for the given version, false otherwise.
Since:
1.3.1

getDestinationDirectory

String getDestinationDirectory()
Returns the documentation output directory.

The driver will be able to determine the destination directory as soon as output generation by JavaDoc starts.

Returns:
the documentation output directory or null if not known at this time.
Since:
1.9.0

configure

void configure(Logger logger,
               Configuration configuration)
Indicates that this driver has been chosen as the JavaDoc driver for the current run and should initialize itself.

Parameters:

configuration - the configuration to use.
Since:
1.3.1

convert

Object convert(SimpleTaglet taglet)
               throws IllegalStateException
Converts the specified SimpleTaglet to a JavaDoc compliant taglet.

The type of taglet returned depends on the JavaDoc version this driver adheres to. JavaDoc included in J2SE 1.4 requires a different taglet interface as JavaDoc included in J2SE 1.5. Therefore the driver is highly JavaDoc version specific.

Returns:
the JavaDoc compliant taglet.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if no JavaDoc compliant taglet for the specified SimpleTaglet is available.
Since:
1.3.1
